timeline.message: OC-537 Fixes based on code review
OC-513 ~ Spring 5, Hibernate 5 and other version updates. JUnit 5 does not work without major changes, unit tests are commented for now.
OC-513 ~ Updates framework and library versions.
OC-513 ~ Removes commented code.
OC-513 ~ Sets 'schema_version' as Flyway table name.
OC-513 ~ Removes final from entity methods to resolve Hibernate warning.

OC-513 ~ Reverts --tags not @NightlyBuildOnly to --tags
~@NightlyBuildOnly.

Somehow the test-jar-with-dependecies can not be started when using
'not' instead of '~'.
OC-513 ~ Resolves Cucumber warings regarding deprecated "--tags ~@Tags".

timeline.bodyText: Why are these validations on request and response set to false?
timeline.author: smvdheijden

replies.bodyText:
Request validation now set to true. This means we validate all requests against the schema, which sounds a bit expensive to me in the context of this 'distributed-monolith' application OSGP. But other components also do it so aligned now.
Response validation is set to false everywhere, which makes sense to me. Otherwise we would be validating JAXB responses we generated ourselves.
replies.author: akoster

timeline.bodyText: Why is this class needed? Couldn't you use the default handling in the ProtocolResponseMessageListener without introducing a new class?
timeline.author: smvdheijden

timeline.bodyText: This name confuses me, is this class processing requests to get data, sent from osgp core to the domain adapter?
timeline.author: smvdheijden

replies.bodyText:
The idea was that the domain adapter triggers a GET_DATA request via core to the PA. Then data arrives at the PA and is sent as new requests back via core to the domain adapter. Actually these are asynchronous GET_DATA events, but such a concept does not really exist in OSGP. So I had to choose between response data (incorrectly implying synchronicity) or request data (incorrectly implying that a response is expected). I chose the latter.
However, you indicated via Slack that this is confusing and, lacking the concept of events, it is better to use response messages for this. So I will take a look to see if I can still manage this change in the remaining time.
replies.author: akoster

replies.bodyText: Done. Switched from request flow to response flow.
replies.author: akoster
